page.title: 14A FARMERS DAY
page.content: A dairy farmer's day begins early.The cows are brought in from the fields at 6:30am to be milked.This takes about 2\ hours,to milk and to clean the milking parlour and wash and sterilise the equipment.Then it is breakfast time .If there are any calves to be taken to market,the farmer puts numbered tags into their ears and loads them into the calf trailer.After he comes back from the cattle market he looks at the cows to see whether any calves are due to be born.If so ,the cow is brought into a loose box so that it is warm,dry and clean. Normally the cow will calve on her own with out any problems.The rest of the morning is spent talking to sales men,dealing with bills and recording the amount of milk the cows produce. After lunch most of the field work is such as spreading fertilizer,ploughing
